fact_list.fact_text: The 'Basic Theory of Driving' handbook is essential reading for all road users in Singapore, which comprise the pedestrians, cyclists, motorcyclists and drivers.
The Highway Code includes the traffic rules, traffic regulations, traffic signs and signals, and it aims to educate and promote road safety for the road users.
Many of the rules and regulations in the Code are legal requirements, and if you disobey them, you are committing a traffic offence.

You may be fined and given demerit points on your driving licence for disobeying rules and regulations, which may lead to suspension or revocation of your driving licence, or disqualification by the Courts from driving.
Knowing and applying the traffic rules and regulations in The Highway Code could significantly help to reduce road accidents, casualties and fatalities on roads.

A driving licence is a legal document issued by the Traffic Police under the Road Traffic Act, which identifies the licensee, sets out the classes of vehicles which he/she may legally drive and states such restrictions or conditions as may apply as well as the period for which the licence is valid.
In order to qualify for a driving licence to drive or ride a motor vehicle on the roads in Singapore, an applicant must meet several requirements.
An applicant for a driving licence must be at least 18 years old.
An applicant must have passed the test of competence to drive to qualify for a driving licence.
An applicant must not be suffering from a mental disorder to qualify for a driving licence.
An applicant must not be suffering from epilepsy to qualify for a driving licence.
An applicant must not be liable to sudden attacks of disabling giddiness or fainting to qualify for a driving licence.
An applicant must be able to read a series of 6 letters and figures in white on a black background from a distance of 25 metres (with the aid of glasses, if worn) to qualify for a driving licence.
An applicant must be able to distinguish the colours red, amber and green from a distance of 25 metres to qualify for a driving licence.

Work Permit and S-pass holders need to pass the Basic Theory Test to convert their foreign driving license to be allowed to drive all Class 3 vehicles except for light goods vehicles, mini vans and small buses.
The Class 3CA licence is introduced to new drivers who only want to drive automated Class 3C vehicles.
